docs.summary:
The wix-crm-backend module contains functionality for working with
 [your site's contacts](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-your-contact-list)
 from backend code.
description: To use the CRM API, import `wixCRM` from the `wix-crm-backend` module:

params.name: contactInfo
params.doc: The information for the contact being created or updated.

ret.doc:
Fulfilled - The ID of the new or updated contact.
Rejected - Error message.

docs.summary: Creates a new contact or updates an existing contact.
description: The `createContact()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the newly
created or updated contact's ID when the contact has been created or updated.
The passed [`ContactInfo`](#ContactInfo) object must contain at least one
Calling `createContact()` performs one of the following. (The contact information
specified in the `contactInfo` parameter matches an existing contact if it
contains an email address or phone number from an existing contact.)
+ If there is no matching existing contact, a new contact is created using the
+ If there is a matching existing contact, it is updated with the information
specified using the `contactInfo` parameter. Any existing contact information
that is not explicity overriden in the `contactInfo` parameter retains its

examples.title: Create a new contact
body: export function myBackendFunction(firstName, lastName, email, phone) {

extra.description:
This example contains a backend function that creates a new contact and
 returns the new contact's ID to the code that called the function.

notes:
You cannot use the `createContact()` function to update contact information
 for existing site members. You can use use it to update other site contacts.

docs.summary: An object that contains information about a site contact.

members.name: loginEmail
members.doc:
Email address the contact who is also
 a member uses to log into the system.

members.name: labels
members.doc:
List of contact's labels. [Labels](https://support.wix.com/en/article/creating-contact-labels)
 are used to organize contacts. When setting the `labels` property, you can
 only list labels that already exist in your site's [Contacts List](https://support.wix.com/en/article/accessing-your-contact-list).

members.name: customFields
members.doc:
Any
 number of custom fields. [Customs fields](https://support.wix.com/en/article/adding-custom-fields-to-contacts)
 are used to store additional information about your site's contacts. When
 setting a custom field, use key:value pairs where the key matches the names
 defined in your site's [Contacts List](https://support.wix.com/en/article/accessing-your-contact-list).
 You can only set values for custom fields that already exist in the Contacts
 application.
